content.description: Steep, quartzite slab climbing followed by jugs to the top. Thin, crimpy climbing through the first two bolts to a clipping hold for the third bolt, followed by mostly large holds above. A mantle onto a narrow ledge awaits after the fifth bolt.
content.protection: 6 bolts, chain anchor. If top roping after leading consider extending the anchor point about three or four feet to avoid rubbing on an edge below the anchor.
content.location:
The west-most (right-most) of the routes in the

Ed and Terry Gully

. It is the one of two bolted routes and is the only route located on a west-facing slab. After traversing from the main

Ed and Terry Wall

through a small gap, head downhill for 20 feet and then scramble south and up to the belay area.

content.description: Fun crack climbing and an awesome squeeze chimney on great rock.
content.protection: Medium to large size gear to chain anchor
content.location: Crack/chimney system to the right of Jugs Judy.

content.description: Fun semi steep climbing on jugs.
content.location: Bolted line on the left side of the wall. Lower off.

content.description: Great crack climbing on good rock.
content.protection: Medium to large sized pieces to a chain anchor.
content.location: Wide crack system to the left of Jugs Judy.

content.description:
Short but "holy cow" amazing.

As you head around to the gully from the main face, the crack is facing you up to the left. Short ramp leads to a short finger crack. This is one of those buggers that you have to decide if that little spot is going to take pro or your fingers.
